title: [K-12] Understanding by Design (UbD)-Based Language-Integrated Practical Course for IoT Core Concept Mastery: Strengthening Technical Text Analysis, Writing, and Presentation Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming concepts, internet usage experience, foundational grammar and vocabulary skills for explaining technical content, and experience in reading simple technical documents
context.additional_context: IoT application training in constrained smartphone environments, integrating technical document comprehension, writing, and presentation skills. Aims to develop practical language competencies: structuring technical texts, using specialized terminology, logical expression, and visual aids.

learning_goals: Learners explain three or more components of IoT systems (e.g., sensors, actuators, gateways) and operational principles (e.g., data collection-transmission-processing), and demonstrate the ability to articulate them accurately in technical documentation formats.

Learners design a process for transforming everyday problems into IoT solutions using design thinking methodologies (empathize-define-ideate-prototype-test) and create structured texts (e.g., problem definition documents, solution specifications) that systematically explain technical content.
Learners implement simple IoT scenario simulations using block-based coding tools (e.g., Scratch for IoT), document the process step-by-step, and present it following a logical flow.

Learners analyze cross-domain cases (e.g., smart homes, agricultural IoT) to logically evaluate IoT applicability, then compile findings into structured reports (e.g., introduction-body-conclusion, with tables/graphs).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
